title: My PC turns on, beeps once, then turns back off and keeps repeating the. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you don’t feel comfortable fixing computers: bring it to the nearest computer repair shop. If you do, you can try replacing the ram (an issue mostly associated with the symptoms you describe). A good way to check if this is the issue, is if you have two ram sticks inserted in your pc, remove one of them(remove ram sticks only when it’s turned off), then turn the pc back on to see if it is fixed. If it isn’t, re-insert the removed ram stick, and remove the other one, then start the pc again and see if that fixed the issue. If it didn’t, it’s not the ram, and you have crossed one problem of the list of possible problems ;)

Two possible scenarios. Number 1 the power supply is having issues, so if you have one sitting around that can run the rest of the rig I’d try that. Else it might be trying to spit out an error code with the beeps, but this is unlikely due to it only being one beep. If it’s failing to even do an error code then that sounds like either the motherboard or power supply are on death’s door. Without having the technical specs I’d try a local computer shop or repair service. Sorry for not being of more use.
